title: Two-Option Choice
description: Offer your child two acceptable choices to encourage decision-making.
content_data: {"steps": ["Present two realistic choices (e.g., 'Do you want apples or grapes for snack?')", "Allow your child to make the decision", "Praise the act of choosing, not just the choice itself"]}

title: Self-Pack Practice
description: Guide your child to independently pack for an event or day at school.
content_data: {"steps": ["Create a packing checklist together", "Let your child pack their own bag", "Do a final review together, celebrating effort"]}

title: Future You Reflection
description: Help your child reflect on actions by thinking about their future self.
content_data: {"steps": ["After a decision, ask 'What would Future You want you to do?'", "Discuss how choices affect outcomes", "Reinforce responsible thinking with praise"]}

title: Try-First Habit
description: Encourage your child to attempt a task before asking for help.
content_data: {"steps": ["Set the expectation: 'Try first, then ask if stuck'", "Praise attempts, even if imperfect", "Guide them only after effort is shown"]}

title: One Step Plan
description: Break big goals into manageable steps with your child.
content_data: {"steps": ["Ask: 'What\u2019s one small step you can take?'", "Write it down and make a plan", "Celebrate progress after the step is completed"]}

title: Mini-Win Reflection
description: Encourage your child to recognize daily improvements.
content_data: {"steps": ["Ask: 'What did you get better at today?'", "Focus on effort, not outcomes", "Repeat regularly to build habit"]}

title: Effort Detective
description: Help your child spot effort in themselves and others.
content_data: {"steps": ["Ask: 'Where did you notice effort today\u2014in yourself or others?'", "Reinforce that effort matters more than ease", "Model noticing and naming effort aloud"]}

title: Mistake Story Sharing
description: Model resilience by sharing mistakes and learnings.
content_data: {"steps": ["Share a time you messed up and what you learned", "Ask: 'Have you ever had something similar happen?'", "Reframe mistakes as growth"]}

title: Eye Contact Game
description: Build social confidence by practicing eye contact.
content_data: {"steps": ["Practice looking into each other\u2019s eyes while speaking", "Play a game of who can maintain eye contact the longest", "Reflect on how it felt to give and receive attention"]}

title: Compliment Practice
description: Teach your child to give and receive meaningful compliments.
content_data: {"steps": ["Give your child a specific compliment about effort or kindness", "Help them think of a compliment to give someone else", "Discuss how it felt to express appreciation"]}
